The woman standing second from the right of the photo is called Wassa. With her loan she is planning to buy ten 25kg sacks of salt. In her current situation as a widow, the profits she makes from this business will be divided into two and one part will be used as expenses for the condiments.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 46-years-old. He is married with six children, four of whom go to school. He is a farmer who grows coffee, cassava and sugarcane for sale. He also rears some cows and pigs at his residence.

Charles wants a loan 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) to buy building materials to complete his residential house. He intends to buy cement and iron sheets and pay for labour. Charles' family's living standard is not good and he hopes to improve it after completing the residential house.

Charles' dream is to educate his children up to higher institutions of learning. However, he is challenged by the changing weather condition.

loans.use: to buy building materials for his house.

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: La Sra. Gina  tiene 24 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada,  ella vende sus productos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de Puerto Rico,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Gina  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor como chompas y chamarras  para surtir su negocio ya que se acerca la época de frio, y esta época tiene mucha venta e incluso pedidos , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Gina  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar electrodomésticos para su casa, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Gina  se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en: Gina is 24 years old. She sells seasonal clothing. She sells her products at her sales spot located in the community of Puerto Rico. This loan is her first cycle with the institution. Gina is going to use this loan to buy clothes wholesale, such as sweaters and jackets to stock her business. The cold season is coming and she sells a lot at that time, she even gets orders. The reason she is asking for this loan is her lack of capital. Gina faces challenges in her business, such as daily competition. She is going to use the profits to buy appliances for her house. She wants her business to have merchandise stocked to offer a variety of products to her customers. Gina is happy and grateful with the institution for the support it has given, since it has allowed her to improve in her business.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Zavkiya

texts.ru: Завкия очень добрая и трудолюбивая женщина, она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Дети взрослые старшему 20 лет, а младшему 12 лет. Её отец умер, когда ей было 19 лет. Она осталась с матерью и маленькими сестрами и братом. Условия жизни у них были очень тяжелые. Несмотря на тяжелые дни, она окончила Педагогический институт столицы. После занятий в институте, она работала в заводе по производства хлеба, чтобы заработать деньги для  содержания семьи. После окончание ВУЗ-а начала преподавать в средней школе. Вышла замуж и родила инвалидную дочь. Муж развелся с ней. Вышла замуж во второй раз. Муж уехал в Россию на заработки, и там проработал 2 года. Приехав на Родину, он начал заниматься скотоводством и электро - мастером. Его заботливая жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. Откармливают скот для реализации. Полученный доход используют для лечения дочки. Родители мужа у них на содержании. На заработную плату  нельзя и содержать семью и оплатит учёбу сына. Завкия решила обратиться за займом, так как их единственный сын хорошо учится и поступил в ВУЗ, а оплачивать нечем. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы сына в университете.
texts.en: Zavkia is a very honest and hardworking woman. She is married and has three children; the oldest is 20, and the youngest is 12. Her father died when she was 19. She was left with her mother, younger sister, and brother. Life was very difficult for them. Despite these difficulties, Zavkia graduated from the capitol city's Teachers' College. After classes, she would work at a bread factory to earn money to support her family. After graduating from college, she started teaching at a high school. She got married and gave birth to an invalid daughter. She got divorced, and remarried. Her husband left to work in Russia, and worked there for two years. After returning home, he began working raising livestock and as an electrician. His thoughtful wife helps him run the business. She fattens the livestock so they can be sold. They use the income to treat their daughter. They also support her husband's parents. On their income, they cannot afford to support the family and pay for their son's college. Zavkia decided to apply for a loan, since their only son is a good student and has been accepted in college, but they cannot afford to pay for it. She is requesting a loan to pay for her son's college tuition.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s education at the university

loans.name: G.s Marcelino Group

texts.es:
La joven Wendy  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a  sus 2 hijos y esposo. Su negocio es una pulpería desde hace varios años, la cual es muy visitada y conocida por los vecinos de su colonia. 
Wendy necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como manteca, arroz, frijoles, maíz, frijoles, azúcar, refrescos, pan, churros, entre otros que necesita para satisfacer la demanda que le hacen sus vecinos. Con el préstamo ella espera que las ventas aumenten y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Wendy al igual que sus compañeros de grupo esperan en un corto plazo su negocio crezca y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a sus familias y que sus hijos continúen con los estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.
Doña Yesenia su negocio es la venta de ropa  desde hace 5 años.
Doña Diana su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace 3 años.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio del  2013
texts.en:
Wendy is a very hardworking and responsible young woman. She lives in a community in southern Honduras with her 2 children and her husband. Her business is a small store she has had for several years. It is visited by and well known to the residents of the neighborhood.

Wendy needs the loan to buy more products, such as lard, rice, beans, sugar, beverages, bread, churros, and more. She needs them to fill the demand of her neighbors. With the loan, she hopes that sales increase and thanks to this she will be able to improve her family's quality of life with the increase in income in the home.
 
Wendy, like the other members of the group, hopes to make her business grow in the short term and this way keep supporting her family, and for her children to stay in schools so they can have better opportunities in life.

Yesenia's business has been selling clothes for 5 years. 
Diana's business has been selling tortillas for 3 years. 



Choluteca, Honduras – July, 2013

loans.use: to buy lard, rice, beans, corn, sugar, beverages, bread, churros, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 31-years-old. He lives in Vanadzor with his wife and a small son. Samvel’s wife is unemployed and she takes care of their son. Samvel has no higher education but he manages to run his own business. 

Samvel has a car washing center in a space he rents. He has been in this business for two years and the income is too low. Only having a small family helps Samvel to overcome all the difficulties connected with his family needs and his business.

Samvel is requesting a loan of 300,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) to be able to provide new a carpet cleaning service. He wants to buy equipment for cleaning carpets, a rack for the carpets and a water line installation.

loans.use: to buy equipment for cleaning carpets, a rack for carpets and a water line installation.

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Yoeurn is a 47-year-old mother of seven children. Two of her dependent kids are in school. To cover her daily cost of living, she does rice cropping on a one-hectare area, with which she has been involved for 10 years. This is the second cycle for Yoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her successful past loan, which she has repaid back completely, has enabled her to sustain her living better than before. 

Now she joins a group of three female members and she is the leader. She is applying for 500,000 KHR while her joint members are seeking 700,000 KHR each. Yoeurn will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to boost her crop output. She highly believes that she can make a good yield with high income so she can expand her business more.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to boost her crop output.

loans.name: Gandariya

texts.en:
Mrs. Gandariya, 46 years old, lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling children's clothes by renting a stall at a trade center since 2011. Her elder son studies at the university in China. 

She has an idea of making and selling bed covers to local people. For this cause, she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase textiles and a sewing machine. If her new business succeeds, her family income will be increased and she can invest in her children's education. She is a very hardworking individual and it is not easy to raise two children alone.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a very kind and intelligent woman and she lives with her daughter in Vanadzor city. Unfortunately she became a widow several years ago. 

Emma has graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute and she has become a teacher of Armenian language and Literature. 

She works at the nearby village school as a teacher. Emma says that her decision to become a teacher is a result of her Armenian language and literature teacher, who was a very wise and clever woman and whom Emma loved and respected very much. 

Emma also gives paid individual courses at her home and prepares children for the entrance examinations. 

Emma is requesting a loan of 400,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) to buy a computer so that she can develop her educational programs both for her individual courses and for school lessons.

loans.use: to buy a computer so she can develop her educational programs both for her individual courses and for school lessons.

loans.name: Assata

texts.fr:
Madame  Assata  est âgée de 43 ans,  mariée  et mère de six enfants, elle vit chez son mari dans une famille nucléaire dans le village de Banankoro dans la commune de Sanankoroba dans la région de Koulikoro  (2ème  région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant été forcée d’abandonner les bancs scolaires très tôt pour des raisons de mariage, elle commença vite le commerce auprès de son mari pour pouvoir subvenir à ses petits besoins. Elle mène cette activité depuis 5 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle a une grande réputation dans cette activité car elle dessert les clients de la capitale.
Pour augmenter son fonds dans le double souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de renforcer son commerce, elle a  fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 12 mois. Après un 1er  prêt  individuel correctement remboursé, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel  qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 200 sacs de charbon de bois et un chargement de camion de bois de chauffe, elle s’approvisionne sur place avec les jeunes du village et des villages environnants.
Madame Assata vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes   majoritairement.  Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA, ce dernier lui servira de prendre en charge certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assata is 43 years old and married with six children. She lives with her husband in a nuclear family in Banankoro in Sanankoroba commune in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali)
She was forced to leave school at an early age in order to be married, but she quickly started to work in trade with her husband for the purpose of financing her own needs. She has been working for five years now and has a large clientele of mainly women. She enjoys a very good reputation in her business as she serves the customers from the capital.
To increase her stock in the interests of both answering the needs of her customers and enhancing her business, she appealed to Soro Yiriwaso, she has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for 12 months. After a first individual loan correctly repaid, this is her second individual loan which she intends to use to buy 200 bags of charcoal and a lorry load of firewood, she buys her stock locally from the young people of her village and the neighbouring villages.
Mrs. Assata sells her wares for cash or credit to her customers who are mostly women. With this loan she plans to make a monthly profit of 100 000FCFA which will enable her to pay for certain family expenses.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Kosal is married and blessed with one little kid. For the sake of her child, she does rice cropping with support from her husband, who also uses his spare time in working for others for a fee for extra income. The two years' engagement in her current business has returned her about 33,000 KHR per day. 

Kosal, who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four cycles, has been enabled to better support her business as well as her family in a gradual manner. For this cycle, she is the group leader with other two female members. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and herbicide for her farmland. She highly believes that she can make more income from her crops and send her child to school until graduation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicide for her farmland.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 42 years old, married, and has four children - a son and three daughters. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the Agdam region. Murad now lives in the Absheron region with his family. His son go to preschool. 

Murad started his new business a year ago. Now he needs a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy spare parts. He wants to use the profits for his son and daughters' future. In the future, Murad wants to buy a new car. This will be more profitable for his business. Murad is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again. This his second loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Vjollca

texts.en:
Vjolla is 33 years old. She is married and a mother of 3 children between the ages of 2 and 9 years old. Currently, two of them go to school. Her husband works as a guard with a very low salary and she is a housewife and stay at home mom. 

Because she doesn't have enough money, she could not renovate her old bathroom, which is in urgent need of repair as it has a longstanding problem and is unsanitary. Now she is asking for a loan in order to renovate her bathroom.

The loan will help her to improve the living conditions of her family and create healthy and clean conditions. She is very grateful for this opportunity to improve her family’s health and living conditions and she appreciates all of the lenders!

loans.use: To renovate her bathroom.

loans.name: Essowazou Group

texts.fr: Mr Komla est né en 1963. Il est père de famille dont 03 scolarisés. Sa femme est cultivatrice. Il est responsable du groupement nommé ESSOWAZOU constitué de femmes et d’hommes qui ont tous mis leur confiance à la terre. Ils sont tous dans l’agriculture et cultivent du mais, sorgho, riz et du niébé. Depuis 1995, Mr Komla est dans ce domaine et est aidé par 03 personnes. Il veut construire une maison et prendre soin de la famille avec les profits réalisés.
texts.en: Mr. Komla was born in 1963. He has children and three of them attend school. His wife is a farmer. He is in charge of the group named ESSOWAZOU that is made up of men and women who have all invested in land. They work in agriculture and grow corn, sorghum, rice and black-eyed peas. Mr. Komla has worked in this field since 1995 and is assisted by three workers. He hopes to build a house and take care of his family with the profits he will make.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Sourou-Guetom Group

texts.fr: Nassirou né en 1954 est marié et père de famille. En 1994, il a démarré l’agriculture en RÉGION CENTRALE et aidé par 02 personnes. Son troisième prêt sollicité à WAGES lui permettra d’acheter des outils de travail afin d’agrandir sa superficie cultivable. Il espère avec le profit supplémentaires faire le commerce de planches et assurer le bien – être de la famille. Notons qu’il est responsable d’un groupement nommé SOUROU – GUETOM composé d’agriculteurs, ils cultivent tous le maïs et envisagent de  voir leurs activités et leurs familles se développer.
texts.en: Nassirou was born in 1954 and is married with children. In 1994 he started up agriculture in the Central Region and has two assistants. This is his third loan from Wages and will enable him to buy tools so that he can cultivate a larger surface area. He hopes that with the additional profits he will be able to start a business selling planks and ensure his family's well-being. It should be noted that he is in charge of a group named SOUROU-GUETOM that is made up of farmers who all grow corn and hope to see their businesses and their families develop.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Darkhanchimeg

texts.en:
Darkhanchimeg, 38 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband built their house five years ago. She has been working as a teacher at a high school and recently took her maternity leave. Her husband is a salesman at an outdoor market.

The house Darkhanchimeg and her husband built five years ago has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repairs. So, Darkhanchimeg is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass, and foam. Using those materials, she and her husband can make their old house more comfortable and warmer. The renovated house also will enable the family to burn less coal for heating, release less pollutants, and contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
A local farmer from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Mach is 40 years old and married. She has four children. Two of her children work at the factory, one helps with the family’s business, and the remaining one is studying at a local primary school. Besides rice cropping on one hectare of farmland, Mach also raises pigs while her husband works at a construction site for extra income. Mach has been involved in her business since she was 20 years old.

Mach is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past loans completely and they have enabled her to support her living. Now, Mach is seeking a new loan in order to buy a decent motorbike for her kids to travel back and forth to their workplace, to buy more pigs for raising, and to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her hand tractor, as well as to pay the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes to triple her income and set aside some money for future needs.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her kids to travel back and forth to their workplace, to buy more pigs for raising, and to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her hand tractor, as well as to pay the plowing fee for her farmland

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Sambo, originally from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, is 53 years old and has eight kids. Currently, only one school-aged child relies on him. His main sources of income are from rice farming and fishing. His current business that he has had for ages earns him about 19,600 KHR per day. 

Sambo is a new client to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is seeking a loan to buy a boat, a small boat machine, and a fishing net. He hopes these purchases will support his fish catching business better than before and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a boat, a small boat machine, and a fishing net

loans.name: Sreyleab

texts.en:
Sreyleab is 33 years old and a mother of two dependent kids. The rest of her family resides in Bati district of Kandal province.  Her source of income is from working as a factory worker and rice cropping. She has been involved in her current business for five years, earning about 38,200 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Sreyleab with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely and improved her living conditions. Now, she is seeking a new loan to buy a cow to support her farmland. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crops and to make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy a cow to support her farmland

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang, in her late 20s and the mother of one child, is a local farmer from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, where her hometown is. To struggle for the family's daily cost of living, she grows cassava and cashew nuts on a one-hectare area each. She has had this business for four years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Neang is not a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has used her past loan wisely to support her business on a timely bases, which has returned her a decent profit to buy decent food for her child. Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. She takes her new loan to pay a plowing fee and to buy potash and insecticide for both of her crops. She hopes to gain a good yield with a high income, better than before.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee and to buy potash and insecticide for both of her crops.

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
Sum, 60 years old and a mother of five children, is a farmer from Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She earns a living via cassava and bean farming. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is a second-time borrower. Her first loan, which she has fully repaid, enabled her to gain prompt support for her business and to improve her life. 

Now, she leads a group of two to apply for a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay a weeding fee and to buy potash for her cassava. She hopes to make a good profit and keep her child in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: To pay a weeding fee and to buy potash for her cassava.

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbaatar, 52 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for 20 years and secured permanent customers in the outdoor market. His wife currently took her vacation and is not working. His son got married and lives separately. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase shingles, cement and putties. Using those materials, he wants to renovate his house. By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is used for heating. Reduction in coal usage will contribute to the efforts against air pollution by releasing less pollutants. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase shingles, cements and putties.

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.en:
Work in education requires much sacrifice and follow-through in teaching/learning. Aware of this, Savriniso works as a history teacher at a school, teaching youngsters of various ages in the school. She impacts knowledge with dignity. Her main concern is educating these people since they the future of the nation and must improve their standards of living. She has been working in this field more than three years. Her colleagues know her as hardworking and smart. 

She is also a good wife and lovely mother of eight children. Her husband is a master of repairing cars. Her children are non-adults. Some of them go to school. She must buy books, notebooks and school uniforms for her children but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 3,500 somoni. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy books, notebooks and school uniforms for her children.

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila lives in the Absheron region of Azerbaijan with her family. She is 57 years old and has four children. She is looking after her children alone because her husband died. 

Nazila started a cafe business five years ago. Now she needs a loan of 1,800 AZN to buy a fridge for her cafe. In the future, she wants to use her profits to pay for home repairs and, in the future, Nazila also wants to repair her cafe. This will be more profitable for her business. She is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her cafe

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Kampong Cham province, Sophorn is 44 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom still count on her as they are still in school. The rest of her family relies solely on paddy rice farming and cassava cropping on two-hectare areas each. She has been involved in her current business for ages. From this business, she can earn up to 28,000 KHR per day. 

Sophorn is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads her group of two members to take a new loan. Her entire loan portion will be spent on purchasing fertilizer. She hopes this purchase will help her to boost her crop yield significantly and bring in a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean, 60, is a married father blessed with three kids. He lives in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, where he does his business. To support his entire household, he does rice cropping on 3 hectares. This is the business that he has had for ages. 

Mean is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is seeking his new loan to buy fertilizer and potash and pay for plowing fees. He hopes to make a good yield and more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potash and pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 30 years old. He is a father of three children aged between 7 and 1. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during rice production.

loans.name: Gorette

texts.en:
Gorette is 43 years old. She is married with three children. She has been in rice production for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the farming will be used for providing food for the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en:
Kakha is 43-year-old married man living in the town of Kutaisi with his wife, school-age son and father. Kakha’s mother lives and works abroad and sends money to her family. His father earns a living wage by driving. Kakha is jobless at the moment. There is a high unemployment rate in the region, especially among people up to 40. Kakha is a very enthusiastic man and wishes to provide his family with a good income. That’s why he decided to start up a secondhand car parts store. 

As he lacks experience with the new business and does not qualify under income requirements, local credit providers rejected his loan request. However,  It was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program provides startup and re-startup credits with reduced requirements for the vulnerable poor who do not have access to many credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the amount he is asking for, Kakha will purchase damaged cars for a bargain price, pull them into pieces and sell parts with a price markup. Kakha is a hardworking person with a great desire to ensure that his son receives a good education to progress in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. Kakha is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to start a used car parts store.

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en:
Simon is a 37-year-old married mother residing in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is blessed with four children, three of whom are in school. She does rice cropping and cassava growing on one and a half hectare areas each to support her entire family. This business, in which she has been involved for ages, has returned her about 25,000 KHR per day. 

Simon, a third-time borrower, and her co-borrower, who is a first-cycle client, are seeking a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loans have enabled her to sustain her living better than before. For this new cycle, Simon will spend her loan portion of 1,000,000 KHR to buy potash for her crop husbandry. She hopes to make a good profit from this business.

loans.use: To buy potash for her crop husbandry.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en:
Nak, a rice and cassava farmer from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province, is 36 years old and blessed with four children. 

His business, which he has had for several years, has earned him about 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Nak with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of five to take out a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy seed, potash, and insecticide for his paddy rice. He hopes to gain a yield from his rice and improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy seed, potash, and insecticide for her paddy rice.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Chen's Group

texts.en:
Chen, a local villager from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, is 33 years old and married. She has three kids in school. Her main business is rice cropping. She has been involved in her current business for 15 years, earning about 19,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for Chen’s group, which consists of four female members. Chen and her co-borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Chen will spend her loan portion to buy gasoline for her hand-tractor, rice seed, and insecticide for her crops. She hopes to gain a good yield from her business and to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, gasoline for her hand-tractor, and insecticide for her crops

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Kimhean's Group

texts.en:
Kimhean is a villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a single lady who does rice cropping on two hectares of land. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years and it has earned her about 23,000 KHR per day. 

Kimhean is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely and improved her lifestyle. For this new loan cycle, Kimhean has formed a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, Kimhean will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her farmland. She hopes to get a higher yield and more income than before.

loans.use: To buy potash for her farmland.

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
Sinoun is 53 years old and married. She is a villager from Bakan district of Pursat Province. Her main sources of income are from a wedding embellishing business and rice cropping; it is a business that she has had for several years. 

This is not the first loan for Sinoun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her loan with success to improve her lifestyle better than before. Now, she forms a group of three to apply for a new loan. For Sinoun, as a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees and labor costs. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crops and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees and labor costs.

loans.name: Kisaakya Kimwanyi2 Group

texts.en:
Robinah is a single mother with four children of whom three are school going. 

She is our repeat borrower in her second cycle. She borrowed a loan of UGX 300,000 through the group for the purpose of paying tuition for her children. Her business is selling banana peelings, which she collects from neighboring markets and rubbish pits. 

Robinah is innovative because she turns waste into income. She is so happy with her business because she uses only small capital and yet earns good profits from it. Her main clients are well wishers and farmers within the city and its outskirts who use the peels to feed their animals or spread in their gardens to fertilize them. She wishes to borrow more loans from Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. so as  to buy a plot of land and built a home for her family.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the Agdam region. Now he lives in the Absheron region with his family. Nizami is married and has four children - two daughters and two sons.

Nizami started a business raising chickens and ducks one year ago. Now he needs a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy chickens and ducks. He wants to use the money for his family's future. In the future, Nizami wants to have a better farm for poultry. This will be more profitable for his business. Nizami is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again. This is his third loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy chickens and ducks

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 28 years old. She is a mother of three children between one and six years old. 

She has been a rice farmer for the past one and a half years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the farming will be used for providing food for the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi is married and has three sons and a daughter. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the Agdam region. Vidadi lives in the Absheron region with his family. 

Vidadi started his taxi business 21 years ago. Now he needs a loan of 1,500 AZN to repair his car. He wants to use the profits for his sons' and daughter's future. 

Vidadi is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again. This is his second loan. He changed his old car after capital repairs and bought this car on the photo two years ago.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Leng is married and blessed with seven children. Currently, only two still count on her as they are in school. 

For her, rice farming and vegetable selling are her main source of income, while working others for a fee is the supplementary income from her husband. 

This is the first microloan for Leng's group, consisting of three members, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Each of the members, including her, are seeking  1,000,000 KHR. For Leng, who is the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy gasoline for her hand tractor and to buy four sacks of potash for her crops. She hopes to gain a good yield and make more income so that she can plant cassava for extra income.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for her hand tractor and to buy four sack of potash for her crops.

loans.name: Xenia Margarita

texts.es:
Xenia tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 5,6 y 7 años respectivamente, su esposo la abandono con sus hijos. Ella solo estudio hasta quinto grado en la escuela;  se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto  a sus hijos quienes estudian y dependen de las actividades que ella realiza.

 Xenia  se dedica al comercio de ropa para hombre, mujer y niños; oficio que aprendió de su madre ,para comercializarla  lo hace de forma ambulante en el lugar donde reside y en los cantones aledaños.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mas ropa para hombre, mujer y niños; con el objetivo de surtir el negocio, ya que lo invierte no es suficiente y de los ingresos que genere podrá darle el sustento a su familia

su deseo es construir su casa de ladrillo, pues en la actualidad es de lamina y en invierno se introduce mucha agua cuando llueve lo que le daña un poco la mercadería y la salud de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Xenia is 30 years old and a single mother of 3 children, ages 5, 6, and 7 respectively. Her husband abandoned her with the children. She only studied up to 5th grade in school. Xenia rises at 4:30 a.m., together with her children who attend school and are dependent on her activities.

Xenia sells clothing for men, women, and children, a business she learned from her mother. She does this on the streets in her neighborhood and in nearby cantons.

The loan she is soliciting through Fundacion Campo is for purchasing more clothing for men, women, and children, with the object of stocking her business, since what she has invested is insufficient. The loan should generate increased income to sustain her family.

Her desire is to construct her home of bricks. Currently, it's made of zinc sheets and in winter, lots of water enters when it rains, which damages her merchandise as well as her children's health.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for men, women, and children to sell.

loans.name: Roeung's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province where she plants her crop, Roeung is a widowed mother of one child. 

Her main source of income is from her single business, two hectares of rice farming. This is the business that she has had for several years and it has returned her about 15,000 KHR per day. 

Neither Roeung nor her co-borrower have been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. They are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She highly believes that she can grow her crops timely and get a good crop output.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 39 years old. He is the father of one child, 14. He has been a rice farmer for the past 21 years. With this loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs for rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs for rice production.

loans.name: Egide

texts.en:
Egide is 27 years old. He is married and has one child, aged three. He has been a rice farmer for the past nine years. 

With the loan he would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits after harvest will be used to pay for his children’s school fees. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 30 years old. She is single and engaged and hoping to get married soon. She has been a rice farmer for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs during rice production. The profits from the farming will be used for providing food for the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is 51 years old. He is a father of seven children between 7 and 22 years old. 

He has been farming rice for the 33 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help raise the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during rice production.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo con quien vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Olga esta orientada a la agricultura, tiene un extenso terreno de 12 hectáreas las cuales  ha destinado a la siembra de diferentes cultivos. Tiene 8 hectáreas sembradas con cacao, sin embargo 4 hectáreas están distribuidas con la siembra de plátanos, cítricos y maíz. Su terreno fue heredado por sus padres y repartido en partes iguales a cada uno de sus hermanos. Adicionalmente tiene 4 hectáreas más de su propiedad en la que espera aumentar sus cultivos sembrados. Inicialmente trabajaba sola, ahora trabaja con ayuda de su esposo y eventualmente de otras personas cuando se incrementa el volumen de su cosecha. Comenta que le gusta la vida en el campo, además ha aprendido a sobrellevar el ritmo del trabajo y sabe como ejecutarlo ya que desde muy joven cumplió esta función con ayuda de sus padres. Sin embargo, asegura que el cansancio físico es constante ya que es una actividad que exige mucho esfuerzo, a pesar de ello le llena de satisfacción los ingresos económicos que percibe ya que eso le permite tener el dinero necesario para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico y de semillas certificadas para ampliar una hectárea más de cacao.
texts.en:
Olga, 48, is married and has one small child who lives with her in her own house.  She earns her living in agriculture and has a large plot of 12 hectares on which she plants different varieties of seeds.  She has 8 hectares of cacao and 4 of bananas, citrus and corn.  The land was passed down from her parents, who divided it equally between her and her siblings.  Olga also has 4 more hectares on which she hopes to plant additional crops.  At first she worked by herself, but she gets help now from her husband and eventually from other people once the size of the harvest increases.  

Olga says she likes country life.  She has learned to endure the rhythm of work and knows how to get the job done because she learned from her parents when she was very young.  She assures us, however, that physical fatigue is incessant because the work requires a great deal of effort.  In spite of that she is fully satisfied with the income she makes because it allows her the money she needs give her family a better quality of life.  

At this time Olga is requesting a loan of 3000 soles.  She is so excited to know that there are people who will provide economic support for her to continue her work.  She promises to be a responsible and punctual member.  She'll invest her loan in the purchase of organic fertilizer and certified seeds so she can plant another hectare of cacao.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and certified seeds to increase production.

loans.name: On's Group

texts.en: A mother of one schoolchild and three paid workers who resides in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, On is 42 years old and a widow. She raises rice for a live, a job that she has had for 10 years. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), On and her joint borrower are in their third and fourth cycles, respectively.On has managed to use her past two loans wisely to upgrade her lifestyle at a good pace. Now, she is seeking a new loan in order to buy 10 sacks of potash to support her farm. She hopes that she can gain a good income from her business so that she can set aside some money for when she gets old.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of potash for her farm.

loans.name: Lok

texts.en: A 44-year-old mother of one little kid from the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Lok is a local farmer who raises rice on one hectare of land. This job pays her about 18,000 KHR per day. Lok is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She used her past loan wisely to improve her lifestyle. Now, she is seeking a new loan to buy potash and rice seed and to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crop and improve her family's hygiene.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seed and to build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Chong's Group

texts.en:
Chong is 41 years old and married. In the family consisting of five children, Chong needs to support only two kids who are in school. For the sake of her two dependent kids, she grows rice  on one hectare area with the support of her husband; this is the business that she has had for ages. 

Chong is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leader in a group of three female members to take out a new loan. Chong will spend her loan portion to buy insecticide and to pay for her farmland. She hopes that she can minimize loss due to pests and gain a good yield from her crop instead.

loans.use: To buy insecticide and to pay for her farmland

loans.name: Sreypich

texts.en:
Originally from Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Sreypich is 28 years old and married. She is blessed with one little child. She covers her daily food consumption via working at garment factory and rice farming while her husband helps to earn extra income. The six years' involvement in her current business has returned her about 34,000 KHR per day. 

Sreypich is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has fully repaid her past three loans and used them wisely to uplift her lifestyle. For this cycle she is seeking with her loan to buy a decent motorbike for commuting back and forth to her workplace and to buy water pump to support her rice field. She hopes to own a motorbike so that she can reduce her transportation cost which she used to cover and to supply water for her crop in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and a water pump

loans.name: Samith

texts.en:
Samith is a citizen from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, where rice is the well known crop in the area. 

She has been growing rice as her main source of income for her family. She supplements her income by selling soft drinks. Her husband works for others for a fee for extra income. The current business, which she has had for 10 years, has generated her about 125,000 KHR per day. 

Samith is in her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has repaid completely, have enabled her to improve her family's living conditions gradually. 

Now, she is seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR in order to buy more soft drinks for resale. She hopes to make more profit so that she can set aside some money for when she gets old.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Rola

texts.en:
Rola is a 45-year-old married Lebanese woman with five children, one of whom is still in school. Her husband works as a taxi driver.

Rola has sold beauty products and cosmetics from her home for thirteen years. She now wants to open her own shop, so she is applying for a 1500 USD loan through Kiva’s partner Vitas s.a.l. With it she will buy makeup, creams, shelves and a new locker to display her products attractively. She hopes to be able to open her own shop as soon possible so she can increase her income.

Rola is very optimistic and is sure the loan will impact her life positively.

loans.use: to buy makeup, creams, shelves and a new locker for her shop

loans.name: Roeuy's Group

texts.en:
Roeuy, 63, is a widowed mother of three children. As a single mother and a breadwinner in the family, she grows rice on a half hectare area and tailors clothes for extra income. The business that she has had for 30 years has enabled her to generate about 27,200 KHR per day. 

Roeuy is a seven-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans with success to improve her living conditions. Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. She is seeking a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR in order to buy potash and pay for the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than last year and make more income.

loans.use: To buy potash and pay for the plowing fee for her farmland.

loans.name: Dismas

texts.en:
Dismas, 46 years old, has been a rice farmer for 28 years. He has requested a Kiva loan to purchase more fertilizers and help pay labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help uplift his family's standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 46, is a widowed mother of one independent daughter and currently is residing in Sa Ang district of Kandal province. She has been involved in her business, rice cropping, for ages. 

Pov, who is new to VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner), is seeking her loan to buy pre-paid top-up cards for resale to earn extra income and to renovate her house. She hopes this new business will improve her living better than before.

loans.use: to buy pre-paid top-up cards for resale.

loans.name: Sovang

texts.en:
Sovang, 48, is a parent of seven children. She is a villager from Sa Ang district of Kandal province. To strive for a living for her three dependent kids, she works at a factory. She has occupied her job for five years. 

Sovang is not new to VisionFund as she is a third-cycle client with VisionFund. Her past loans have enabled her to support her family and keep her kids in school. With this new loan, she is seeking to buy a decent motorbike for commuting and to renovate her house. She hopes this purchase will minimize the transportation costs which she used to cover and enable her to renovate her house in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike for commuting and to renovate her house

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha is 39 years old and has five children, two of whom are in school. For her family, rice growing is a main source of income and she raises pigs to supplement the family’s income. She has been involved with thes current businesses for several years. 

This is the third time for Pha to have a loan with VisionFund. The past loans which she completely repaid have improved her family's living conditions with decent food. Now she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland and use a portion to pay the plowing fees. She hopes to make a good income to provide her family with better living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 35 years old. He is married, with four children. He has been a rice farmer for the past 18 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generating 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employing approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Naihen's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from Kampong Cham province, Naihen is 43 years old and blessed with four children, two of whom are in school. To support her living, she can earn up to 20,000 KH per day from her rice paddy farming and cassava planting.

Naihen, who is new to Kiva partner VisionFund, is leading a group of two to request a loan. She will spend her portion to buy potash and to pay the transplanting fee for her crops. She strongly believes she can raise her business income and better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy potash and pay the transplanting fee for her crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Célibataire, Akossiwa revend des produits cosmétiques, des pagnes dans sa boutique et par moment de façon ambulante. N’arrivant plus à satisfaire les besoins des clients, elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises de quoi répondre aux besoins de ses derniers. Elle espère à l’avenir, réinvestir dans l’activité pour tirer plus de profit et se lancer plus tard dans la vie maritale.
texts.en: A single woman, Akossiwa sells cosmetics and "pagnes" (lengths of African print cloth) in her little shop and sometimes door-to-door. As she is not able to satisfy the needs of her customers, she has requested a first loan from WAGES to buy merchandise that will satisfy her clientele's demand. She hopes in future to reinvest in her business so as to have more profit and later launch herself into married life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and lengths of African print cloth.

loans.name: Nantiele

texts.fr: Revendeuse de tubercules et divers dans un marché de la ville de Lomé, madame Nantiele est mariée à un chauffeur. Ils ont 02 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Âgée de 35ans, elle s’est lancée depuis quelques temps dans cette activité et elle le fait avec plaisir. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite de WAGES son second prêt pour acheter des tubercules. Avec le profit, elle veut augmenter le capital, élargir son activité. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut au coté de son mari, assurer l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en: A seller of tubers and various items in a market in the town of Lomé, Madame Nantiele is married to a driver. They have two children, both attending school. Aged 35, Madame Nantiele started up this business some time ago and she takes pleasure in it. To boost her business, she is asking WAGES for her second loan to buy tubers. With the profit, she wants to grow her working capital and expand her business. In future, she would like to cooperate with her husband to ensure that their children are educated.

loans.use: to buy tubers to sell

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
A rural farmer from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Phea, in her late 40s, is a mother of five children, one of whom is still in school. She strives for a living via pig-raising and working for others for a fee. Engaged for two years in her current business, she is able to earn up to 20,000 KHR per day.

Phea is not new to Kiva partner VisionFund. Her past loan, since repaid repaid, helped to support her business and send her child to school. Now leading a group of three to request a new loan, Phea will use her portion to buy more pigs to raise. She hopes she can fatten her pigs healthily so that she can make more income in order to renovate and expand her house.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 57 años de edad, es casada convive junto a su esposo 61,   tres  hijas de 20, 25  y 27 años, y su nieto de aproximadamente 2 años de edad. Es una persona que solo estudio hasta cuarto grado en la escuela, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Ella se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposo e hijas quienes depende de las actividades que ella realiza.

Ella,  se dedica a la agricultura a sembrar maíz; actividad  que aprendió de sus padres.  Para llegar a las parcelas camina 3 Km  y trabaja junto a su esposo y su hijas durante la mañana y en la tarde su esposo se dedica a cuidar una finca. Ademas, de las labores agrícolas, Teresa se dedica al cuido de unas vacas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca; para producir leche la cual podrá vender y obtener ingresos para el sustento de su familia

Uno de sus propósitos es, comprar mas vacas lecheras para producir leche y  elaborar lácteos como queso, crema y quesillo y así en un futuro poder construir una casa digna de ladrillo para su familia; ya que actualmente es de adobe.
texts.en:
Teresa is 57 years old.  She is married and lives with her 61-year-old husband; her three daughters who are 20, 25, and 27 years old; and her grandson who is about two years old.  She is a person who only attended school through the fourth grade, and her husband makes a living through agriculture.  She gets up at 4:30 am, along with her husband and daughters who depend on the work that she does.

She makes a living in agriculture by growing corn; an activity that she learned from her parents.  To get to the plots of land she walks three kilometers.  She works alongside her husband and daughters in the morning, and in the afternoon her husband works as a farm caretaker.  In addition to the agricultural work, Teresa makes a living caring for cows.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a cow to produce milk that she will be able to sell and thus get an income to support her family.  One of her intentions is to buy more dairy cows to produce milk and make dairy products like cheese, cream, and quesillo (a traditional small soft cheese); and thus in the future be able to build a suitable brick house for her family because the current one is of adobe.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to produce milk that she will be able to sell and thus get an income to support her family.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 50 years old and is married with six children aged between 20 and 13, all of whom go to school. He has been a rice farmer for the past 27 years. With this loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and to support his labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to improve the living standards of his family. Joseph can be seen in the photo with fellow rice growers in the background.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and support labor costs on his rice farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finance a social business that will help 120 poor, rural Albanian women earn a livelihood from making beautiful traditional Albanian handicrafts, and distribute these to the European and international markets.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es: Eloisa se ha trasladado a otra parte de la ciudad de La Paz, continúa trabajando como maestra en una unidad educativa, anteriormente recibió ayuda de Kiva para pagar la tesis de su hija, ahora es ella quien desea tomar un curso de post grado y actualizarse, para eso necesita un nuevo crédito, puesto que su situación es más difícil y competitiva que antes
texts.en: Eloisa has moved to another part of the city of La Paz, but she continues to work at a school as a teacher.  She previously received assistance from Kiva in order to pay for her daughter’s thesis.  Now it is she who wants to take a postgraduate continuing education course.  For this reason, she needs a new loan since her situation is more difficult and competitive than before.

loans.use: to pay for a postgraduate continuing education course.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 36-year-old farmer from the community of Jagna, Bohol. She is married with six children, ages two months to 10 years old. Elisa has been farming rice for ten years now to support her family. She is asking for a loan of 4000 PHP to buy fertilizer, seeds and a sprayer. The income will be used for her family's consumption and pay for household bills.

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger farm which is more profitable so she can send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and a sprayer

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim is 32 years old and a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, where she runs her business. She has a 0.5 hectares area for growing crops, works for others for a fee, and raises pigs as the main sources of her income to address her family's hardship. These businesses have returned to her about KHR 18,900 per day. 

Kim is a fifth-time borrower and her co-borrower is a second-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). After the successful past loans that Kim has fully repaid, she has improved her lifestyle better than before. 

Now, she is a group leader and is seeking a new loan to buy potash, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs. Kim hopes that she can increase her income and gain back a good yield.

loans.use: to buy potash, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Callixte

texts.en:
Callixte is 45 years old and has been a rice farmer for the past 18 years.  He has requested a loan so that he can buy more fertilizers and support the labor costs of his rice production. Profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs on his rice farm

loans.name: Soknan

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Soknan is a 28-year-old married father with one daughter who is too young for school. He earns a living through chicken-raising and he has been in this business for three years. With his current business, he can earn about 13,600 KHR per day. 

This not his first loan with VisonFund. He has successfully repaid the previous loan and it helped his family improve their lifestyle. Now he is seeking a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) in the amount of 700,000 KHR to buy chickens to raise. He hopes to improve his family’s lifestyle further.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Oscar Humberto

texts.es: Don Oscar de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar pero no poseen luz eléctrica, él el trabaja de jornalero en diferentes casas que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con el pago  que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Oscar  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que con lo que ganan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra él  y su familia se podrán beneficiar ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
Oscar, who is 53 years old, lives with his family in his own home, but they do not have electricity. He works as a day laborer in different houses close to his residence. With the money that he earns, he has been able to resolve some household expenses.

Oscar requests this loan so that he can buy a solar lamp, since he cannot afford this with his salary. The lamp is a station powered by energy from solar panels that is made for homes in rural areas with no electricity.

With this purchase, he and his family will benefit since they will have their own light at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
A rural villager from Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, Sarorn is 31 years old and a mother of one son, who is too young for school. Sarorn is a farmer who grows rice as a main source of her family's income and also plants soybeans to earn extra income. She has been engaged in farming for one year and she is able to earn about 35,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sarorn has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for a loan with VisionFund in the amount of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland and she will use some part of the loan to pay for labor fees. She hopes this loan can provide her with high crop yield and good income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 55 years old.  He is a father of six children, aged between 27 and 16. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to improve the living standards of his family.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs for maize production

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Don Francisco tiene 61 años de edad, es casado. Es un hombre que desde muy pequeño le ha gustado trabajar y se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas, por lo que su nivel de estudio solamente llego hasta el 2° grado; ahora en día su esposa le brinda apoyo en todas las actividades que realizan criando pollos de engorde y cuidando los cultivos. Tienen 2 niñas, una de 9 años que estudia 3° grado y la otra de 11 años que estudia 5°grado, estas dos pequeñas además de estudiar realizan labores en apoyo a sus padres realizando tareas del hogar y ayudando a alimentar los pollos cuando se requiere.

El cliente se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, desde hace 8 años que decidieron emprender este negocio con su pareja y también dedica parte de su tiempo a cultivar pequeñas parcelas de hortalizas, que le ayudan a solventar algunas necesidades económicas, ya que también comercializa verduras en el mercado. Con la ayuda de su esposa tiene que viajar hasta la ciudad, para adquirir los insumos (pollos y concentrados) para su producción y para obtenerlos tienen que caminar casi 1km de distancia para abordar el medio de transporte que los lleva hasta la ciudad que esta aproximadamente como a 18 km y en el regreso con los materiales (bolsas de harina y cajas con pollos) deben de cargarlos en su espalda hasta llegar a su casa.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de mas pollos de engorde, para cubrir la demanda de carne que tienen en el mercado que ellos manejan; por lo tanto el crédito cubrirá la necesidad de aumentar su producción comprando una camada de 100 pollos mas y la harina que será el alimento para su desarrollo y así obtener mayores ganancias para solventar las necesidades de su familia.

En el futuro don Francisco quiere tener unas galeras más grandes que le permita incrementar la producción y que con el apoyo de fundación campo piensa construir para ampliar su negocio, ya que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa e hijas para el trabajo que se requiere.
Además, él dice que quisiera darles la oportunidad de tener estudios superiores a sus 2 hijas para que puedan valerse por ellas mismas, ya que él no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar quiere que sus hijas se superen y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Francisco, 61, is married and has a second grade education only because ever since he was very young he has enjoyed working on the farm.  His wife helps raise the chickens and care for the crops. They have two daughters, a nine-year-old in third grade and an 11-year-old in fifth grade.  The girls also help their parents with the housework and with feeding the chickens when necessary.

The borrower has been raising chickens for eight years with his wife, and he also spends time cultivating vegetables which he sells at the market to help cover some expenses.  With the help of his wife, he travels to the city to buy supplies (chickens and feed) and must walk a kilometer to catch transportation to the city which is 18 Km away.  The materials (bags of flour and crates of chickens) have to be carried on their backs all the way home.

The loan will be used to buy more chickens to be able to meet the market demand.  The loan will increase production since there will 100 more chickens and the flour will be used to feed them.  This will result in increased profits to cover family needs.

In the future, Francisco wants to have bigger coops so he can increase production.  With the support of the Fundación Campo he hopes to expand his business since he has the support of his wife and daughters when he needs it.  He also wants to give his daughters the opportunity to get a university education so they can become professionals and earn a living,  since he was unable to study.

loans.use: To buy 100 chickens and flour for feed.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Don paulino de 56  años de edad vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en casa propia pero no posee luz eléctrica, trabaja de jornal en una casa que está cerca de su lugar de residencia con el pago que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don paulino está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde el reside nadie posee luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en: Paulino, 56, lives with his wife and three children in their own house which has no electricity.  He works as a hired hand on a house near his home and uses his salary to cover household expenses.   Paulino is requesting a loan to buy a solar lamp because no one has electricity in his community and he does not earn enough to pay for it.  The lamp he wants uses solar panels as energy.  It is useful in homes in rural areas where there is no electricity.  With this purchase his family will benefit by having their own light at night.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 34 años, está casada con Cayo y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Elizabeth se dedica a la agricultura y tiene 2 hectáreas de terreno para cultivo que compro junto a su esposo hace más de 10 años y se convirtió desde entonces en su principal sustento económico.
Trabaja todos los días junto a su esposo realizando actividades de mantenimiento  a sus plantaciones de cacao y café para obtener una producción de calidad, el cual vende a los comprandores del lugar logrando recuperar el dinero que suele invertir durante la campaña productiva. Tiene la suerte de tener terrenos muy fértiles que le permiten obtener buenos productos , no obstante suele fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico. Tiene la costumbre de contratar a trabajores del lugar para que le apoyen en la cosecha y el deshierbo de sus plantaciones. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo según comenta es partir las mazorcas de cacao y con la ayuda de una cuchara extraer las almendras de cacao que son secados en grandes toldos a la luz natural. Dentro de sus planes a futuro esta poder construir su vivienda a base de material noble con la intención de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En está ocasión contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 34, is married to Cayo and has two children living with her in her house made of adobe.  Elizabeth works in agriculture and has two hectares of farmland she and her husband bought together more than ten years ago; since then it’s been their main source of economic support.

She works alongside her husband every day doing maintenance chores on her cocoa bean and coffee crops in order to yield good quality harvests that she sells to local buyers succeeding in recuperating the money she tends to invest in each planting season.  She’s lucky to have such fertile land that leads to the best products.  

Nevertheless, she tends to fertilize her farmland with organic manure.  She’s also in the habit of hiring local laborers to help with the harvesting and weeding.
