What she enjoys the most about her work according to what she says is splitting the cocoa bean stalks with the help of a spoon to extract the cocoa beans that are then dried on large tarps in natural sunlight.

In her future plans is to be able to build her house out of substantial building materials in order to improve her family’s quality of life.  On this occasion she needs 2,000 new soles to buy organic manure.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
Yet, 63, is a mother of six children, living in Battambang province. Three of her children are still in school. 

Selling grocery items is a main source of her family income, while her husband is distilling alcohol to earn an extra income. 

Yet has never been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) before. She forms a group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund Cambodia. 

As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy grocery items for resale. She hopes to expand her business to make a good income, to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Santos Alonso

texts.es: Santos de 34 años de edad  vive con su esposa y su hijo de 6 años de edad en casa propia pero no posee luz eléctrica, él trabaja de jornal en diferentes casa que están cerca de su vivienda con el pago que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Santos está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que con lo que ganan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra él y su familia se podrán beneficiar ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en: Santos, 34, lives with his wife and six-year-old son in their own house which has no electricity.  He works as a hired hand at different houses near his home, and uses his salary to cover some of the household expenses. Santos is requesting a loan to buy a solar lamp because he does not have the money to do so.  The lamp uses solar panels as energy.  It is used in rural areas where there is no electricity.  With this purchase, he and his family will benefit by having their own light at night.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Rosa Emerita

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 40 años de edad, esta acompañada, convive junto a sus hijas de 10, 13 y 17 años. Ella solo logro estudiar hasta séptimo grado, su compañero de vida trabaja en la agricultura; ella por su parte, se dedica al comercio de mariscos, como pescado y camarones;  oficio que aprendió de su madre. Para comercializarlos, lo hace de manera ambulante cargando una hielera para que no se le arruine los mariscos, y lo sale a vender en el lugar donde residen y en los cantones aledaños. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto  hijas quienes estudian y dependen de las actividades que ellos realizan.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una hielera más y más pescado, camarones y otro tipo de mariscos para diversificar la oferta. Su demanda es bastante grande, ya que también le realizan pedidos de otro tipo de mariscos y con el préstamo dispondrá del dinero para comprarlos y satisfacer a su clientela. 
	
	su objetivo, es ahorrar para comprar un vehículo y transportar la mercadería (mariscos); ya que actualmente lo hace a pie, le resulta muy difícil y cansado.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old, in a relationship, and lives with her daughters (ages 10, 13, and 17). She only completed school through the seventh grade and her partner works in agriculture. For her part, Rosa sells seafood such as fish and shrimp. She learned this trade from her mother. In order to sell her products, Rosa must travel around and carry a cooler so that the seafood does not spoil. She conducts her sales in her neighborhood and in the surrounding areas. Rosa wakes up at 4:30 A.M. Her daughters study together and are dependent on her business activities.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy another cooler and more fish, shrimp, and other types of seafood in order to diversify her offerings. She is experiencing a large enough demand since she also receives orders for other types of seafood. With this loan, she will have the available funds to buy these items and satisfy her customers. Her goal is to save toward the purchase of a vehicle for transporting her merchandise (seafood). She currently travel by foot, which is both difficult and tiring.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, fish, shrimp, and other types of seafood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, poisons and foliar feeds.

loans.name: Hermana Unida Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado HERMANA UNIDA está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Anatalia es una de las integrantes, ella es de una colonia pequeña en distrito de la ciudad Concepción donde tiene su pequeño negocio de Venta de frutas y verdura ,mercería, y producto de limpieza y también carnicería,  su local esta en su casa particular  y desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio, como ser comestibles y bebidas y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group called “Hermana Unida” is in its third loan cycle as part of the Committee Program. The members are from the city of Concepción, in a growing area that is some distance away from the downtown section. This area is difficult to access, so the members of this group are determined to grow so that they can create a better environment in their neighborhood and promote steady development.

Sra. Anatalia is one of the members. She lives in a small neighborhood in a district in the city of Concepción. There she has a small business where she sells fruit, vegetables, sewing supplies, cleaning products, and meat. Her shop is located in her home where she passes the time. By helping everyone in her neighborhood, the surroundings improve and families feel more secure. This results in everyone having a better future.

Anatalia is requesting a loan in order to buy products for her business, such as food and beverages. This will allow her business to continue growing. As a result, her family can experience a life without deprivation.

loans.use: to buy food products and beverages to sell in her business.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Don Juan tiene 61 años de edad, es casado.  Es un hombre humilde que desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo, realizando labores agrícolas y que por las necesidades que sufrieron cuando estaban pequeños, no tuvo tiempo para estudiar porque su padre nunca les dio la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, él les decía a todos: “ustedes tienen que aprender a trabajar porque de eso van a comer si van a la escuela se van a volver haraganes y no van a poder trabajar” es por eso que no tuvieron la oportunidad de ir a una escuela para aprender; luego que decidió formar su familia su esposa ha sido su apoyo, han logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos de los que a su cargo solo tiene 2 jóvenes, 1 trabaja para ayudar a sus padres y el otro estudia en la universidad; gracias al sacrificio de don Juan para que no se repita la misma historia con sus hijos. 

El cliente se dedica a cultivar granos básicos, desde muy pequeño él recuerda que aprendió cuando su padre lo llevaba, se recuerda que le compro una Cuma pequeña con la que él se divertía al principio, pero poco a poco fue aprendiendo y fue despertando el interés por hacer bien las cosas, para cuando creciera él pudiera trabajar como jornal y ganar su propio dinero. Ahora en día  tiene que caminar 500 mts a pie hasta llegar al lugar donde tiene su cultivo.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de insumos (fertilizantes y herbicidas) para aportar a la nutrición adecuada a su cultivo y preparar la tierra para la siembra de frijoles; por lo que solventara la necesidad de dar un buen manejo a su cultivo para obtener la producción esperada gracias al apoyo de fundación campo. 

En el futuro don Juan, piensa solicitar otro crédito al inicio de la plantación de su cultivo, para dar un mejor manejo a su milpa y tener el control de plagas que le puedan causar pérdidas en su cultivo y si fuera necesario sacar crédito para que su hijo termine sus estudios, quiere tener las puertas abiertas en fundación campo para solventar sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Juan, 61, is married.  He’s a humble man who has worked in the fields since he was very little doing agricultural chores because of the need they had since they were little.  He never went to school because his father never gave them the opportunity to do so.  He’d tell them all: “you must learn how to work because that’s what you are going to eat from; if you go to school you will become slothful and will be incapable of working.”  This is why they never had the opportunity of attending a school to learn.  

Later he decided to form his own family and his wife has been his support.  They’ve succeeded in moving their children forward and only have two of the younger ones still in their care.  One of them works to help his parents and the other attends university thanks to Juan’s sacrifice so that his story won’t be repeated with his children.

He works growing basic grains.  He remembers learning alongside his father who would take him along when he was still little.  He remembers that he bought him a small machete that he’d amuse himself with in the beginning but gradually he learned and started to become interested in doing things well so that when he grew up he’d be able to work as a day laborer and earn his own money.  Today, he must walk 500 meters to the spot where his crops grow.


The loan will be used to buy supplies (fertilizer and herbicide) to provide adequate nutrition to his crop and to prepare the soil to plant beans.  Thanks to support from Fundación Campo, this will cover the need he has of providing good crop maintenance in order to obtain the expected crop yields

In future, Juan plans to request another loan at the beginning of the planting season to provide better care to his cornfield and control the pests that can cause crop losses and if necessary take out a loan so that his son can complete his studies.  He wants to keep Fundación Campo’s doors open to cover his needs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to prepare the land to plant beans.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor contínua viviendo en la ciudad de La Paz y en casa propia. También sigue trabajando como chofer en un sindicato de transporte público durante más de 10 horas al día. Necesita crédito para seguir mejorando su vivienda, lo que quiere decir que le hace falta material de construcción para arreglar las habitaciones de la casa. Si es necesario los arreglos los hará con sus propias manos.
texts.en:
Víctor continues to live in his own home in the city of La Paz. He still works more than 10 hours a day as a driver for a public transportation union.

Víctor needs a loan so that he can continue with improvements to his home. He says that he lacks construction materials for remodeling the rooms in his house. If necessary, he will undertake the renovations himself.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Don Daniel de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia desde hace 20 años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maíz y frijol con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita tener una mejor calidad de vida y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Daniel, 63, lives in his own home, and for 20 years agriculture has been his main source of income.  He grows corn and beans and uses the income from sales to cover some of the household expenses.  He wants to buy the necessary supplies for his crops such as fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, insecticides, etc., but he does not have the economic resources to make the investment.  He decided to request a loan so he can continue with his crop activity.

Just like all farmers, Daniel puts his trust in agriculture because he has no other source of income.  He wants to get ahead by doing the best he can with his crops.  He hopes to obtain an abundant harvest so he can lead a better lifestyle and repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija de 23 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, él se dedica a realizar viajes en su vehículo por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia  tiene mucha clientela por ser un persona responsable a la hora de manejar, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, luis esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, 49, lives in his own house with his wife and 23-year-old daughter who is currently studying.  He works making trips in his vehicle through various neighborhoods near his place of residence.  He has a large clientele because he’s a very responsible driver.  He uses profits earned from work to cover some of his household expenses.

Luis is asking for a loan to buy spare parts and to service his vehicle in order to continue working since this is his only source of income and thus provide his family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Yean's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Yean is 59 years old and the mother of seven children. Her family's sources of income are from cassava and rice farming. This business returns her about 35,000 KHR per day. 

Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, Yean has formed a group of two to take out a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and to pay for a plowing fee. She strongly believes that she can increase her income and gain back a good yield.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay for a plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Khan's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother of three children, Khan is 44 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district in Cambodia. She is a local farmer who grows cassava on three hectares and rubber on one hectare of her farmland to support her family. She has been involved with this current business for 17 years, and she earns about 38,300 KHR per day. 

This is the first time Khan has requested a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She and her two group members are seeking a loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion on fertilizer for her cassava plantation. She hopes to make a good income to provide better living conditions to her family and to build a decent house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive  junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: pan, leche, huevos, alimentos enlatados, agua embotellada, verduras y otros productos más, es una persona muy responsable y amable la cual cuenta con varios clientes a pesar que su tienda no tiene mucha variedad de productos. La clienta solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que el mayor deseo de ella es el de poder surtir su negocio y así percibir mayores ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
This client lives with her husband and their two children.  She owns a store where she sells basic staples like bread, milk, eggs, canned food, bottled water, vegetables and other goods.  She’s a very responsible, kind person who has several regular customers despite her store’s not having a great variety of products.

She’s asking for the loan to have the money she needs to buy larger amounts of products because her greatest wish is to be able to stock her business to earn higher profits and to be able to give her family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Thang's Group

texts.en:
Thang, a local farmer from a town in Kampong Cham province, is 58 years old and has six children. She has been involved in her current business for ages, earning about 38,000 KHR per day. 

Thang is not new to VisionFund. She is a second-time borrower who has repaid her original loan already; it enabled her to improve her lifestyle and allowed her to buy household appliances. 

For this cycle, she leads a group of three; her joint borrowers are first-cycle clients. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and to pay a plowing fee. Moreover, she will spend a portion of her loan to renovate her house. She hopes to gain a good income from her business and to renovate her house in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy potash and pay a plowing fee, and to renovate her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty accessories, hair dye, makeup, clothes, shoes, and toys for which her customers are asking.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.en:
Dilovar has run a bakery business for more than 14 years. There are five people in his family; he lives with his wife and his three children, two boys and a girl. His wife works and her salary is low. 

Since last year, Dilovar has been repairing his house yet there is still some work to be done to finish it completely. He is going to repair all rooms of his house including the bedroom, kitchen, sitting room, etc. 

The loan in the amount of 5,000 TJS is taking for covering some missing building materials for repairing his family's house.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood for repairing his house

loans.name: Abulfaz

texts.en:
Abulfaz is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now he lives in the Baku region with his family. Abulfaz is 37 years old, married, and has two children. His daughter goes to school, and his son goes to university. His daughter wants to be a journalist. 

Abulfaz started his business, raising chickens, three years ago. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy chicken and geese. He wants to use the money for his family's future. 

In the future, Abulfaz wants to have a big farm, as this will be more profitable for his business. 

Abulfaz is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy chicken and geese

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 30-year-old woman from the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married and has one daughter who is 10 years old. She has been raising hogs for four years now, earning an average income of 4,000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy a piglet, feed, and supplements.

It may take a few months for her to see her profit, but she perseveres and works hard for her family. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger barn with a sow and many piglets for better business profits.

loans.use: to buy a piglet, feed, and supplements

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.en:
Primitivo has owned his shoe repair and retail store in Corpus Christi, Texas, for more than two years. At his store, you can receive shoe and boot repairs, leather repairs, and purchase polish and other shoe-care products. Originally from Jalisco, Mexico, Primitivo enjoys Corpus and life here in the United States.

Primitivo learned about Accion Texas Inc. from an Accion employee. The Accion representative explained the many loan programs offered by the nonprofit organization. Once he applied and received his $4,375 Accion loan, Primitivo began using the loan to purchase additional inventory supplies and a shoe stretcher, and upgrade existing equipment. 

Without the loan, Primitivo would not have been able to accept more customers and give them a quick turnaround on their repairs.  The loan helped him do this and increase his revenue. He currently does not employ anyone, but looks forward to hiring an employee in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory supplies and a shoe stretcher, and upgrade existing equipment.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria began Liz Janitorial Services to clean commercial and residential properties around the El Paso, Texas area.  An acquaintance gave her the idea to open up her own business.  When Maria began, she used her own savings to start her business but needed a way to expand her business.

Through community partner Project Vida in El Paso, she was referred to Accion Texas Inc. for a microloan.  She used her loan to purchase a commercial vacuum so that she can work on additional commercial properties, and also purchased cleaning products to continue operating her business and possibly obtain new clients.

With over 12 years of experience cleaning houses and other properties, she is pleased to be her own boss and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a vacuum cleaner and obtain more work contracts.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Residing in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Heng is 58 years old, married, and has six children. To support the family, she has been growing rice and selling grocery items. This is the main source of her family's income. To earn additional income, her husband has been raising pigs and providing driving services. Heng has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She completely paid back the past loan which helped her to improve her family’s living condition. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR. She will use a portion of the loan to build a pig house and a portion of it to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes that her pigs can sell at a good price to increase her income.

loans.use: To build a pig house and buy grocery items to resell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nepo

texts.en:
Nepo, aged 24, is married to Molly, and they have two children aged four and two respectively.  He stays with one dependant, a house helper and pays tuition for one of his children. He is a motorcycle mechanic, and it's his major source of income.

Nepo has approached Ugafode for a loan of Ugx.1,500,000 in order to buy motorcycle spare parts for sell. It's his additional source of income because demand for such items has increased due to rapid growth of the trading centre. He promises to pay after the sale of spare parts.

Nepo dreams of developing his business into a one stop shopping centre for all motorcycle spare parts in his town. This will help him to improve the standard of living of his household. However the challenges include competition, which he hopes to overcome when he gets additional loans from Ugafode because he will be able to buy much more equipment. In the photo is the client left and the ugafode credit officer(right).

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur found a means to earn his living by selling vegetables and different types of home products to local customers. He lives in Gyumri town with his parents and sister and is running his business. Khachatur, by his car, goes from village to village and provides the products that he sells. Due to the fact that the products Khachatur sells are fresh and have good quality, people in the community always buy their products from Khachatur. 

In order to purchase supplies for selling (vegetables and other products), Khachatur has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as a formal business. Khachatur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, this loan will be a good improvement in Khachatur’s life, as he will be able to continue his business and will ensure better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for vegetables and other supplies for selling to customers

loans.name: Tiran

texts.en:
Tiran has been involved in furniture manufacturing. He learned how to work with wood from his father, when Tiran was a little boy. And now over these 10 years of hard work he makes high quality furniture and has gained many loyal customers.

Tiran requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as a formal business. Tiran has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. He needs that financial support for purchasing raw materials and making furniture. Thus the loan is very important for Tiran to continue his devoted work and gather income for his family.

Tiran lives in Kapan town with his wife.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials for making furniture

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan, this extremely poor Egyptian Albanian married man and father of a little boy, needs your help again to stock up on second-hand clothing to resell. The so-called "house" in the background of the photograph is their family house and the little boy standing at the door in the dark, is Hasan's only son. 
Hasan's photo could not be taken at his little activity, because unfortunately he does not have any inventory at this time.

loans.use: to purchase thrifty clothes to resell

loans.name: Guilma

texts.es: Guilma de 34 años de edad, es divorciada y vive junto a sus hijos en su casa de adobe. Desde muy niña apoyó sus padres quienes siempre se dedicaron a la agricultura cultivando productos propios de su localidad como el cacao orgánico, café, barbasco; así como el cultivo y venta de frutas como el coco, plátanos y cítricos. Cuando cumplió 18 años se comprometió y tuvo su primer hijo y se independizo de sus padres para trabajar en los terrenos de cultivo que heredó de sus padres. Actualmente posee 2 hectáreas de cultivo donde tiene árboles de cacao, café y árboles frutales que recolecta y vende los fines de semana en la feria de su distrito logrando obtener ganancias adicionales. En cuanto a sus plantaciones de cacao trata siempre de brindarle un buen mantenimiento con la ayuda de trabajadores que contrata para realizar un trabajo uniforme y obtener una calidad óptima de los frutos al finalizar la campaña productiva. Le agrada mucho su trabajo porque puede obtener dinero en beneficio de sus hijos a quienes apoya en todo lo necesario para que puedan lograr ser profesionales en el futuro. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Guilma, 34, is divorced and lives with her children in her adobe house.  Since she was a little girl she helped her parents, who always worked in agriculture growing products native to their area such as organic cacao, coffee, and barbasco.  They also grew and sold fruits such as coconut, bananas, and citrus.  When she turned 18 she got engaged, had her first child, and became independent from her parents to work on the croplands her parents gave her.

Currently she has two hectares of crops where she has cacao trees, coffee, and fruit trees, which she harvests to sell the fruit on the weekend in the market in her area, managing to earn additional profits.  As for her cacao crop, she always tries to maintain it with the help of workers she hires to do a uniform job and get the best quality from the fruit when the growing season ends.

She likes her job a lot because she can earn income to benefit her children, whom she supports in everything that's necessary so they can become professionals in the future.

Currently she wants to have 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy organic soil amendments.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 45 years old. He is a father of five children. He has been a rice farmer for 15 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generating 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employing approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Protazio

texts.en:
Protazio is an aging man of about 58 years who lives in the rural setting of Kalisizo town. He is a married man who takes care of three children and two grandchildren. He takes care of the grandchildren because their parents are unable to afford their basic needs and have opted to go to the urban centers, trying to find the means of survival. 

Protazio has been in the barkcloth trade for the last 20 years. He has experience of the business and recognizes good barkcloth, since they used to wear it when he was young. He also doubles as a piggery farmer with a project that houses over eight pigs. He describes a challenge of swine flu that attacked the project, killing some of his pigs and retarding his project.

He says he has managed to take care of his family and grandchildren from the income received from the barkcloth trade. He hopes to use the facility extended to him to buy more barkcloth for trade and also to put up more structures for his piggery project.

loans.use: To buy barkcloth for trade and to construct a pig sty

loans.name: Engari Nyekundire Group

texts.en:
Engari Nyekundire Group is located in the outskirts of Engari Town in rural Ibanda.

Lillian is a single mother who lost her husband in 2009 after her husband died in a car accident. She has six children and also takes care of her brother's two children because their father failed to provide for their basic needs.

Lillian runs a small retail shop with capital of UGX 100,000. She also deals in poultry farming which she also operates on a small scale. 

She intends to use the loan money to buy some poultry that she will raise and she hopes to sell them during the festive season. She will use the rest of the money to add stock in her retail shop and the balance to pay school fees for her children.

Lillian's customers are neighbors and restaurant owners in town. Her main challenges are theft around the village and wild animals which attack them after she has invested the loan money which affects her cash flow. Despite all the challenges, Lillian is very hard-working and determined.

loans.use: To buy  poultry feeds

loans.name: Mukama Ya Fugaa Development  Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, a member of 'Mukama Ya Fugaa' group is a hard-working 35-year-old  married lady with four children, Her main source of income is stone quarrying, an activity she has done for a living for about 15 years now. She is committed to changing her family and the life of her children through hard work. Her dream is to construct a house, and she is beginning by buying a plot of land using the loan and her savings from the business. She will soon build a house to provide decent accommodation for her family.

Fatuma is grateful to UGAFODE for giving her access to lower interest rate loans. All the group members signed the Kiva waiver. The gentleman at the extreme left is the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: to complete the purchase price for buying a residential plot.

loans.name: Katende

texts.en:
Katende is aged 60 years and married with 15 children; out of the children, only 7 are school going and he pays their school fees. He is a farmer mainly  growing sugarcane, coffee, and sorghum and maintaining a piggery as his major sources of income. He grows sugarcane for local gin brewing but on a small scale and this is affecting his income from the project.

Katende has now requested a loan of 2,000,000 (Two million Uganda shillings) so that he can buy more land to expand on his sugarcane plantation. The land costs  UGX 4,000,000 and out of this amount he has only 2,000,000 UGX. He hopes that after acquiring this land and expanding his plantation, the income will increase.

However, Katende says that over-relying on agriculture is a challenge, most especially when there has been a change in the weather conditions and in view of  the price fluctuation of agricultural produce on the market. But he is a hard-working person who has been supporting his family using income from agriculture and would like to improve his agriculture with support from Ugafode.

loans.use: to acquire a piece of land

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry has been a client since 2006, having taken several loans between 1,500,000-2,500,000 UGX. He works from Kyaruyenje, a sub-county in the rural Rukungiri District. He is married with a stable family that he provides for.
Out of this business, he has managed to buy more pieces of land to increase food for his family, pay school fees for his children and recently he has managed to build a permanent house which he wants to complete with the loan he is processing.

He attributes all his success to Ugafode and thanks them for the good work they are doing.In the photo is the ugafode staff(left)and the client.

loans.use: To buy building materials for completing his house

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 64 años, está casada con Víctor y tiene 2 hijos que son ya mayores y muy trabajadores. Vive junto a su pareja en su casa propia. Lucia se dedica a la agricultura, este es su principal sustento económico, actualmente posee 3 hectáreas de terreno donde tiene muchos árboles de cacao y trata siempre de brindarles un buen mantenimiento para obtener mazorcas de cacao que posteriormente debe secar a la luz natural siendo está la única manera para obtener el aroma y el sabor que buscan los compradores de la zona que se encargan de transportar este producto natural a las plantas industriales. Realiza su trabajo junto  a su esposo y contrata trabajadores del lugar para tareas complicadas como el retiro de maleza de entre sus plantaciones ya que es parte del cuidado que se le da a los productos. Hasta el momento se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo porque puede estar siempre con su familia y espera con el tiempo cumplir algunos objetivos que tiene en mente como poner un negocio en el primer piso de su vivienda para dedicarse a ello los fines de semana y generar algunos ingresos adicionales a su trabajo en el campo. Desea solicitar en esta oportunidad 2,000 nuevos soles para realizar el primer deshierbo de maleza perteneciente a la actual campaña y necesita pagar a los trabajadores que participaran en esta campaña.
texts.en:
Lucia, 64, is married to Víctor and has two grown, hardworking children. She lives with her husband in their own house and makes her living mostly by farming. She owns three hectares of land with many cacao plants. She tries to keep them in good condition so that later the cacao pods can dry in the sun, the only way to get the aroma and flavor desired by local buyers who deliver the product to processors. She works with her husband and hires local workers for more difficult chores such as weeding between the furrows, which is part of the crop maintenance.

Lucia thoroughly enjoys her work because she can always be with her family. Over time, she hopes to achieve some other goals, such as setting up a business on the first floor of her house that she could manage on weekends to generate income to supplement her field work. She has applied for a loan of  2000 nuevos soles to pay the workers to do the first weeding of the season.

loans.use: to pay local workers.

loans.name: Biruga Omututu Group

texts.en:
Dinah, a married woman of four children, lives in the outskirts of Lyantonde town and sells charcoal in the town center. She began the business to meet the growing needs of her young family. The business was also cheap to begin, yet it was profitable since all the low income earners use charcoal to cook because gas and electricity are expensive.

She wants the loan to increase her stock of charcoal to make it profitable. 

She is hard working, and thanks Kiva lenders for supporting their businesses, which will improve their family's well being.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for sell

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is 64 years and has 14 children aged between 13 and 28; three of the children are still in school. Sulaiman has several sources of income apart from  selling  cows. He also sells green bananas and coffee. 

He has so far taken three loans. With this loan, he would like to buy more cattle for trade. His clients are butcher men. He hopes to raise more funds from this fasting season if he sells in Ramathan. He faces a challenges of price fluctuations, but does not get discouraged because he knows he will make it if he continues to work hard. 

In the photograph is the loan officer(right) and the client(left).

loans.use: To buy more cattle for trade.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 28-year-old man. He is married and does not yet have children. 

Robert's previous loan was 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) and he is now asking for ugx.2,500,000 to buy more stock for his shop. 

Robert opened up his shop in 2010. His dream is to build his own house for his family.He thanks kiva for partnering through Ugafode otherwise he would never have qualified for a loan. He is hard working.In the photo is the client and his wife in their retails shop,they both signed the waiver form.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his shop.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). 

She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil and rice. She generates additional income through selling piped water.

She works in a shop and sells only on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality, ever increasing prices of commodities and transportation.  

She is aspiring to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to educate her children up to university.  She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil and rice.

loans.name: Felipe Nery

texts.es:
Felipe tiene 40 años de edad, casado y con tres hijos. Es una persona que se ha dedicado a trabajar arduamente para que a su familia no le falte nada y que puedan tener vivienda, salud y educación para sus 3 hijos, su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar cuidando a los pequeños y velando por el bienestar y la alimentación adecuada; además 2 de sus hijos están estudiando y dedican tiempo para ayudar a sus padres en las labores del hogar.

Él, es una persona humilde y trabajadora, que se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y sorgo, aprendió esta labor desde muy pequeño con su padre; ya que es uno de los hijos mayores de sus padres; recuerda que su padre le compró una cuma para llevarlo y enseñarle a limpiar la milpa madrugando y trabajando todos los días su padre le decía que aprender a trabajar para ganarse la vida y  darle el ejemplo a sus hermanos más pequeños.  Luego, que decidió formar su propia familia se ha dedicado a cultivar granos básicos. Hoy  en día él enseña a sus hijos a cultivar para que en el futuro puedan desarrollar habilidades de trabajo y les da espacio para que estudien y desarrollen otras habilidades para que en el futuro no tengan que trabajar solo en la agricultura; sino también desempeñando otras labores.

El  crédito será destinado a la compra de materiales para la reparación del techo de su vivienda,  ya que necesita el cambio de la madera y las láminas ya están picadas.

De esta manera se espera mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia, para que a los niños ya no les caiga agua cuando duermen cada vez que llueve. 

Por el momento al cancelar este crédito, ver si se puede sacar otro para construir una habitación adicional en la casa, para tener un espacio más adecuado y más ordenado; ya que gracias a la fundación campo lograra solventar la necesidad de reparar el techo de su vivienda  que por ahora es la prioridad mas grande para que ya no se mojen sus pertenencias.
texts.en:
Felipe, 40, is married with three children.  He’s a person who has worked hard so that his family would have everything they need and so that his three children can have a home, health and education.  His wife does the housework and cares for the little ones seeing to their welfare and adequate nutrition.  Two of his children attend school and also earmark some of their time to help their parents with household chores.

He is a humble, hardworking man who works growing corn, beans and sorghum.  He learned this activity from his father while still very little since he’s one of his parents’ older children.  He remembers that his father bought him a machete to take him along and teach him how to clear the cornfield; he’d rise at dawn and work every day.  His father would tell him to learn to work to earn a living and to set a good example for his younger siblings.

Later, since deciding to form his own family he’s worked growing basic grains.  Today, he teaches his children to farm so that in future they can develop work skills; he also gives them space so that they can study and develop skills so that in future they won’t have to work in agriculture but also be able to carry out other kinds of work.

The loan will be used to buy building supplies to repair his roof at home because the wood and the metal sheeting need to be replaced because they have holes in them.  In this way he hopes to improve his and his family’s quality of life so that rain water won’t drop any longer on the children while they sleep.

When this loan is paid off he’ll see if he can take out another one to add another room to his house so that he can have more, better organized, space.  Thanks to Fundación Campo he will be able to cover the need of repairing his house’s roof which for now is his greatest priority so that his belonging will no longer get wet.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to repair his roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her daughter's secondary school tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his son's tuition payment for secondary school at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Perseverance Group

texts.fr: Groupement solidaire d’hommes et de femmes ayant pour nom PERSÉVÉRANCE tous basés dans l’agriculture (la culture du mais), Mr Tomfei  est nommé par les autres pour les diriger. C’est un jeune homme de 29ans qui est marié à une cultivatrice et a en charge 01enfant de 03ans. Il est à son premier  crédit de WAGES et ce montant l’aidera à s’approvisionner en outils de travail car il est cultivateur. Il est dans ce domaine il y a 07ans et il est basé en RÉGION CENTRALE. 04 personnes l’aident dans l’exécution de son activité. Avec les profits supplémentaires, il veut construire une ferme agricole et augmenter sa superficie cultivable.  Les autres membres espèrent eux aussi avoir un bon rendement et mieux s’occuper de leur famille.
texts.en: This is a united group of men and women, by the name of Persévérance, all based in agriculture (corn farming). Mr. Tomfei has been named by the others to lead them. He is a young 29-year-old man who is married to a farmer and is in charge of one 3-year-old child. He is on his first loan from WAGES and this amount will help him to stock up on work tools because he is a farmer. He has been in this field for seven years and he is based in the central region. Four people help him in the execution of his business. With his supplementary profits, he wants to build an agricultural farm and increase his cultivable surface area. The other members also hope to have a good yield and to better care for their family.

loans.use: to purchase work tools

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina is married with two children and only one of her children goes to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal stoves and candles. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more charcoal stoves and boxes of candles. She has been in this business for 10 years. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal stoves and boxes of  candles.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Doña Lucila, tiene  67  años de edad, esta soltera,vive con una hija en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, hace 10 años  que estableció una pulpería donde vende refrescos, churros, granos básicos, dulces, pan, útiles escolares, achinería, abarrotes,etc. Al negocio le ha invertido dos prestamos anteriores, actualmente solicita el tercer ciclo que es  por 11,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar  más productos para la pulpería con el propósito de aumentar las ganancias, comprara refrescos, churros, granos básicos y productos de abarrotería. Su plan es ampliar más el negocio y mantenerlo siempre surtido ya que es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucila, 67, is single living with her daughter in Puerto Cortes.  She’s always worked in commerce.  Ten years ago she opened a grocery store where she sells soft-drinks, packaged snacks, basic grains, candy, bread, school supplies, low-cost novelty items, groceries, etc.  She’s invested two previous loans into the business.

She’s currently asking for this third cycle for 11,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy more goods for the grocery store aiming at increasing her profits.  She will buy soft-drinks, packaged snacks, basic grains and groceries.  Her plan is to expand the business more and to always keep it well-stocked because this is her source of income.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lupita

texts.es:
Lupita es una joven de 21 años de edad, agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 1 hijo el cual es menor de edad y vive bajo su mismo techo. Ella en compañía de su compañero de hogar trabajan la agricultura su especialidad la siembra y cultivo de café por más de 5 años ya que ella aprendió esta actividad por medio de sus padres siendo ellos agricultores desde toda una vida ya que este rubro es su único medio de ingreso para el sustento de su familia y hogar. Sus clientes pata este producto compradores de café que llegan a la zona para su adquisición como intermediarios o compradores directos.

Hoy en día ella solicita un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas y limpiara sus cultivos de café con lo que al final de la cosecha espera obtener un ingreso por venta esperado con resultados satisfactorios.

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder extender más sus cultivos de café sembrar una mejor variedad de producto más competitivo y atractivo en el mercado con lo cual ella pueda generar mayores ingresos para su familia fortaleciendo el patrimonio para su hijo.
texts.en:
Lupita, 21, is a young housewife and mother of one minor son living under the same roof; she works in agriculture.  She and her housemate have worked in agriculture especially growing coffee for more than five years since she learned this activity from her parents who have been farmers their entire lives; this line of work is the family’s only source of household income.  Her customers for this product are coffee buyers that come to the zone to buy it as middlemen or direct buyers.

Today she’s asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies and to weed the coffee crops so that at the end of harvest with satisfactory results she can earn the expected income.  Her future plan is to extend the coffee crops more and to plant a better, more market competitive variety so that she can earn higher income for her family strengthening her son’s estate this way.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 52 years old. He has spent 30 years in the business of rice production. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generating 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employing approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Jose Reinaldo

texts.es:
José, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos; esta inversión le ayudara los materiales agrícolas necesarios, tales como: semilla, abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a obtener mayores ingresos e incrementar su inventario, es por ello que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan because he needs new working capital to continue investing in his basic grains crops.  This investment will help him get agricultural supplies like seeds, manure, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, etc.

His previous loan helped him earn higher income and to increase his inventory.  Because of this his economic conditions and his family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Jose Rudys

texts.es:
José,  tiene 27 años de edad y vive en casa propia, está casado y disfruta de un hijo de tres años. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos para cubrir los gastos del hogar, el oficio lo aprendió con sus padres  y posee 7 años de trabajar en lo propio, lo realiza de lunes a sábado de 6:00am a 12:00pm.
El préstamo que solicita le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros. Esta inversión le permitirá aumentar la capacidad de inversión  y sus ingresos.
Su sueño es mejorar económicamente y crecer en la agricultura para adquirir buenos ingresos para financiar la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
José, 27, lives in his own house; he’s married and enjoys his three-year-old son.  He works growing basic grains to cover household expenses.  He learned this occupation from his parents and has been working for himself for 7 years.  He works Monday to Saturday from 6am until noon.

The loan he’s requesting is to buy needed agricultural supplies like manure, herbicide, pesticide, fungicide and insecticide, among others.  This investment will make it possible for him to increase his investment capacity and his income.  His dream is to improve economically and to grow in agriculture so that he can earn better income to finance his son’s education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Patricia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Patricia,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que menciona que son una fuente generadora de ingresos para obtener mayores ganancias; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar plátanos, azúcar, arroz, carnes, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares, es por ello que incrementaron sus inventarios y obtuvo mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Patricia needs to take out another loan because she says that they are a great income-generating source to earn higher profits.  This investment will help her buy bananas, sugar, rice and meat, among others.

Her previous loan helped her improve economic conditions and family circumstances which is why her inventory increased and she earned higher income.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sugar, rice, meat, etc.

loans.name: Odalys Cecilia

texts.es:
Doña Odalys tiene una edad de 34 años de edad, es casada, agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 3 hijos de los cuales estudian en secundaria en diferentes grados los cuales al salir de sus actividades estudiantiles ayudan a sus padres con las actividades del campo siendo ellos como familia los únicos que se involucran en sus cultivos de café. Ella cuanta con 6 años de educación teniendo completa la primaria gracias al apoyo brindado por sus padres siendo ellos los que le enseñó y heredaron la tierra que hoy en día junto a su familia trabaja la cual está ubicada a 10 minutos de camino de su casa de habitación. Ella no solo se dedica al cultivo de café sino también a la elaboración de pan de casa los cuales comercializa con los vecinos de su comunidad.

Doña Odalys ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual pretende limpiar, abonar, fertilizar y mejorar sus cultivos de café brindando a sus clientes un producto de calidad y seguridad.

Sus planes a futuro son los de preparar y sembrar un mejor variedad de café, como el borbone, caturra que son productos de mayor calidad y más atractivos para sus clientes. Como madre de familia sus sueños es brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación, prepararlos a nivel universitarios y darles un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Odalys, 34, is married and the mother of three children, who are in middle school. After school, they help their parents with the field work, as the family does all the chores related to growing the coffee. Odalys completed six years of elementary education with support from her parents, who taught her the coffee trade and deeded the land to her. Now she works the land, which is a 10-minute walk from her house, alongside her family. Besides growing coffee, she also makes bread to sell to neighbors.

Odalys has applied to COMIXMUL for a loan to weed, fertilizer, and improve her coffee crop and offer her customers a quality, safe product. She plans to prepare the land and plant better varieties of coffee such as Borbón and Caturra, which are higher quality and more desirable to her customers. As a mother, she dreams of offering her children a better education, preparing them to go to college, and raising their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain her coffee plants.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 42 years old and a resident of Masanafu, a suburb of Kampala city. He is married, with five children, all in school and he takes care of his brother-in-law and sister-in-law, whose parents are incapacitated to meet their basic needs. 

Moses sells watches, a business he started in 2008 with the aims of boosting his daily income and having a steady home. He needs a loan of UGX 3,000,000 (Uganda shillings) to buy more stock to serve his clients better, with a wider range of types of watches. 

Moses sells to all kinds of people since his business is strategically located in the city center. However, his main challenge is inadequate capital. Moses is such a determined and focused man and he aims to acquire more money, in the form of a loan, to boost his business, so that it attains steady growth and expansion.

loans.use: to buy watches to sell.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 20-year-old, single woman from Nalein Village, near Ramallah City. She lives with her family in a very simple house. 

Samar's father is a very hard worker, with low income. Samar could not go to the university because her family could not afford its expenses, but she took several training courses to improve herself, like typing and ICDL (a program for learning about computers). 

For the past year, Samar has had a small library where she sells stationery to the students. It is the only one in her village. Samar's library is a very profitable business, but needs some help to be improved. 

Samar is requesting a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to buy more stationery stocks to improve the library. This will increase her income and improve her family's conditions.

In the future, Samar dreams to improve her library and sell books for all ages. In the photo, Samar appears in her library.

loans.use: to buy more stationery stocks to improve her library.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 53-year-old married man from Jenin city. He lives in a simple house with his wife and five children: three sons and two daughters. 

Sameer has a shoe store in the city. The store has been open since three years ago. It is a profitable business and a well known store in the city. Sameer's store needs some improvements, but he does not have enough liquidity. Sameer's wife works as a teacher to help her husband in the family expenses, and she gets a low income. 

Sameer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more inventory to resell in his shoe store. This will develop the store and increase his income. 

Sameer appears in the photo while he was in his store.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to resell in his shoe store.

loans.name: Burhan

texts.en: This is Burhan. He is a 43-year-old married man and the father of five children; three boys and two girls. He lives in a village called Kufr Raie near Jenin City. Burhan and his family live in a very old house which is in bad condition; it needs a lot of repairs. Therefore, Burhan would like to build a new home. Burhan has requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy construction materials, such as stones and cement. From this loan, Burhan will be able to start building his new home and live in it with his family as soon as possible. This will give them better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as stones and cement.

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is a 42-year-old married man from Gaza city. He is a father for five kids - three sons and two daughters. Emad works as an employee in a global charity in his city and earns a fair income. He always works to improve his work and give more, so he works extra hours.

Emad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his work. By applying this loan, Emad will be able to work extra hours while he is at home.

Emad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his work

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram is a 38-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for six kids - four sons and two daughters. Akram works as an employee in the public sector in his city and earns a low income. This income barely covers the family's needs and it is the only source of income for the family.

Akram took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his work and also follow the news on the internet. By applying this loan, Akram will be able to do his work while he is at home and also read articles and newspapers.

Akram appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his work

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de queso, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia distribuye su mercadería en la ciudad de Cusco y en el distrito de Mollepata, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de quesos.


La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member is Gregoria who continues with her business buying and selling cheese.  She’s a responsible, hardworking woman.  She sells her merchandise in the city of Cusco and in Mollepata District.  She also continues to work in agriculture.  She wants to be able to continue working this way to continue supporting her family.  She’s requesting the loan to buy cheese.   She feels grateful for the loan granted and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sandals, blouses, shirts, pants, dresses, and suits.

loans.name: Rajiya

texts.en:
Rajiya is a 32-year-old married woman from Dharmnagar village of the Sitalpur VDC of Bara District, Nepal. She is married to Jawahir and has two children. 

She and her husband(the man in the photo) have been in the hotel and betel shop business for the last 15 years. She has requested the loan amount of 100,000 Nepalese Rupees to support and expand her existing business to meet the increasing demand of the customers.

She has added 2.5 Katha of land in Sitalpur village through the earnings of the business. She has a good image in her locality as a successful woman entrepreneur. She hopes to expand the business with this loan and wants to ensure a good life and education for her children.

loans.use: to buy betel leaf and ingredients for betel shop business and to buy food items for the hotel..

loans.name: Rajmati Kumari

texts.en:
Rajmati Kumari is a 21-year-old married woman(the man in the photo is her husband) with two children. They live in a small village called Ghusukpur Tole in Kalaiya Municipality of the Bara district of Nepal. 

Within their own house, she has set up a small grocery shop where she sells different types of products like rice, pulse, sugar, etc. She has established herself as a successful micro-entrepreneur in her locality. 

As a result of the success of her shop, she feels it is high time to make certain changes to the business. In particular, she wants to make the shop bigger and offer a wider range of products like rice, pulse, sugar, oil, and other non-food items. So, she requested the loan amount of 40,000 Nepalese Rupees to carry out this expansion. 

She has very good personal references within her community.

loans.use: to buy food and non-food items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is a 31-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is requested a loan for her husband’s fruit selling business. Her husband owns the fruit selling business and her son is also involved with his father's activity, and both equally participate in the household expenses. Ramadan is going on and in this month the demand for fruit is higher. To fulfill the demand he wants to buy more fruit such as mangoes, bananas, apples, etc.

With the increase in the household expenses, Nazia wants to grow the business also. She is the mother of four children; her one son goes to school. Her two daughters are too young and she has to look after them very carefully. 

Nazia wants to save the profit amount so that she could arrange the marriages of both her daughters in future. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will be able to save a reasonable amount soon.

Nazia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Nazia is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy fruit such as mangoes, apples, bananas, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Lucila;La socia sigue de dicandose a la ganaderia y a la agricultura,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,la socia vende  sus vacas en las ferias de los dias sabados a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia desea poder segrui trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.



La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de alimentos y abono para su chacra.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lucila’s the member and continues working raising cattle and working in agriculture.  The member’s a responsible, hardworking person.  She sells cows in the Saturday street market to her customers that request them.  She wants to be able to continue working this way in order to continue supporting her family.

She needs the loan to buy feed and manure for her field.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy feed and manure.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Groupe 43

texts.fr: Makarimal Akhlakh est un groupement d’intérêt  économique qui est née depuis 2003.Il regroupe actuellement plus de 3000 membres  composés dans  sa majorité  de femmes et d’hommes  localisées dans les différentes  régions du Sénégal. La création de ce GIE a pour objet de permettre a ses membres d’exercer des activités de production agricoles et halieutiques, de commerce  général import export, de transport, d’industrie, d’artisanat, de bâtiment, d’élevage, d’exploitation minière, de transport pèche, d’exploitation des hydrocarbures, d’art, de culture, d’imprimerie, de services de menuiserie bois, d’actions d’utilité publique, de représentation, de transformation de produits halieutiques, d’agriculture, de vente de pièces détachées, de fabrique de glace, de boulangerie et de prestation  de service. Il est représenté au niveau national par madame Ramatoulaye  qui a signé un protocole d’accord avec UIMCEC dans le cadre de financement de ses membres ce qui leur permettrait d’acquérir des moyens matériels et financiers nécessaires au développement de leurs activités. Par conséquent Makarimal Akhlakh groupe 43 est un sous groupe de crédit  du GIE qui est composé de 10 femmes représentées par la dame Fatou  (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo). Elles travaillent ensemble dans la même zone. Fatou  est une femme  célibataire et  s’active depuis plus de 5 ans dans le secteur du commerce,  elle  exerce la vente de produits alimentaires et de bijoux. Elle démarre chaque jour ses activités à 7heures du matin pour la terminer a 21 heures le soir. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent d’épargner de l’argent  dans le but de réaliser dans le futur son projet de construction d’une maison.
texts.en:
Makarimal Akhlakh is an economic interest group born in 2003. It currently brings together more than 3000 members and is mostly made up of men and women based in the different regions of Senegal. The creation of this economic interest group has as its goal to permit its members to run agricultural and fishing production businesses, general import-export, transportation, industrial, artisanal, construction, livestock farming, mining, transport, hydrocarbon cultivation, art, culture, printing, woodworking service, charitable activities, performance, fishing product conversion, agricultural, spare parts sales, glass fabrication, bakery and service provision businesses. The group is represented at the national level by Ms. Ramatoulaye who signed an agreement protocol with UIMCEC in the framework of the financing of its members, which permits them to acquire the material and financials means necessary for the development of their businesses. 

As a consequence, Makarimal Akhlakh groupe 43 is the loan subgroup of the economic interest group, which is made up of ten women represented by the woman Fatou (the one with her hand raised in the photo). They work together in the same zone. Fatou is a single woman and got started more than five years ago in the business sector, making sales of food and jewelry products. She starts off each day's business at 7:00 in the morning in order to finish at 9:00 in the evening The revenues that her business brings in allow her to save money in the hopes of making her project of building a new house in the future come true.

loans.use: to purchase food products and jewelry to resell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 51-year-old farmer from the municipality of Jagna, Bohol. She is married with five children ages 8 to 22. She has been farming vegetables for 20 years now. She grows cucumber, tomatoes, beans and spring onions. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy a sprayer, seeds and fertilizer. 

She and her husband work hard to make a success out of their farming. In the future, she hopes to maintain and hopefully make their farm bigger so she can give her children a better future through education.

loans.use: to buy sprayer, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Hun is a married mother of two independent children residing in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province. Her main source of income is solely from rice cropping. The current business has returned her about 27,000 KHR per day. This is the fifth time for Hun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).

The past loan, which she has fully paid back, has improved her lifestyle better than before.  Now she formed a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her crops and to pay for plowing her rice field. She hopes to make more income to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy potash for her crops

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Kaleema

texts.en:
Kaleema is 56 years old woman. She loves her family. Her husband is a lathe worker. He works very hard to provide for his family. This is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase new tools to work on the lathe machine. However, due to lack of finance he finds it difficult. 

Kaleema wants to help her husband. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. Kaleema is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase new tools to work on a lathe machine.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 38 years old . She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a welder by profession, and provides the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase welding equipment for his work. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. 

Therefore his wife, Samina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will be purchasing some important welding equipment including a welding machine, wire brush and welding holder with the loan amount. Samina is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase some important welding eqiupment including a welding machine, wire brush and welding holder for her husband's business

loans.name: Andonassoumana Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    ANDONASSOUMANA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOLA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme ASSANATOU debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village  et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the ANDONASSOUMANA III group are all married women who are, on average, 41 years old, have 4 children, and live in polygamous families in TOLA, a village in SIKASSO, the third largest administrative region in Mali. The collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to continue their agricultural activities during the winter months. They are asking for their fourth loan, having successfully reimbursed previous loans. Mrs Assanatou, who is the first person to the left who is standing in the photo, grows corn. This loan will enable her to purchase labor, fertilizer and seeds to cultivate her 0.4 hectare land. She sells the food products in the village as well as in Sikasso, to both male and female customers. She hopes to earn a profit of 95 000 FCFA (~192 USD) per harvest, which will enable her to pay back her loan as well as aid her husband in covering daily expenses.

loans.use: purchase labor, fertilizer and agricultural seeds

loans.name: Andonassoumana Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    ANDONASSOUMANA  IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOLA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme MINATA assise au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the ANDONASSOUMANA IV group are all married women who are, on average, 39 years old, have 4 children, and live in polygamous families in TOLA, a village in SIKASSO, the third largest administrative region in Mali. The collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to continue their agricultural activities during the winter months. They are asking for their fourth loan, having successfully reimbursed previous loans. Mrs Minata, seen in the photos as the woman standing in the middle, grows corn. This loan will enable her to purchase labor, fertilizer and seeds to cultivate her 0.5 hectare land. She sells the food products in the village as well as in Sikasso, to both male and female customers. She hopes to earn a profit of 90 000 FCFA per harvest, which will enable her to pay back her loan as well as aid her husband in covering daily expenses.

loans.use: purchase labor, fertilizer and seeds for farming

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el socio realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es comprar un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar repuestos para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to make his living in the transportation business.  He has a taxi service on various streets, and he works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  Through this job, he is able to get his children ahead.  His dream is to buy a new car.

The borrower is applying for a loan to buy spare parts for his car.  He is happy for the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en: Theoneste is 34 years old. He is married with four children, and they all go to school. He has been selling beans and sorghum for the past eight years. With the loan, he would like to buy more beans and sorghum for resale. He will reinvest the profits in the business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.en: Ildephonse is 31 years old.  He has been selling sugar, soap, and cooking oil for the past two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more soap and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more soap and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea is 33 years old. She is married to a businessman. She has been running a business for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to make  local beers  for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy more sorghum to make beers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy motorbike.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to make local beers for sale

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
